alert.note: Alert for Grant (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 15 at 3:17PM PDT until September 15 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pendleton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Black Butte burn scar in... Southeastern Grant County in central Oregon... * Until 500 PM PDT. * At 317 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Black Butte Burn Scar. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Black Butte burn scar area. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Black Butte Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Black Butte Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Grant County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
